poem:
### The Silenced Truth

Words fall like leaves  
in a forest of whispers,  
ink stained with silence.  
The crows of truth  
caw against the wind,  
obstructed by the fog  
of power's loud deceit.  
Yet beneath,  
the soil murmurs,  
nourishing the seeds  
of what remains  
unspoken,  
waiting to rise.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. And it becomes even more complicated when the journalists are part". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
